```{r setup, include=FALSE, results = "asis"}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(pacman)
p_load(tidyverse, ipumsr, kableExtra)
```

## Loading data
```{r}
ddi <- read_ipums_ddi("usa_00003.xml")
data <- read_ipums_micro(ddi)
```

```{r}
head(data, n = 10) %>% kbl("html") %>% kable_classic_2(full_width = T)
```

## Cleaing data
```{r}
# Selecting variables tp keep 
data_clean <- data %>%
  select(YEAR, SAMPLE, SERIAL, PERNUM, PERWT, REGION,	METRO,	NCHILD,	NCHLT5,	SEX, AGE,	MARST, RACE, HISPAN, BPL, EDUC, LABFORCE,	CLASSWKR, OCC1990,	WKSWORK2,	UHRSWORK, INCWAGE)

# View first 10 rows
head(data_clean, n = 10) %>% kbl("html") %>% kable_classic_2(full_width = T)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
